backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the gym tracker backend, defining data types (exercises, workouts, user profiles, recovery states) and an exercise library with workout generation and recovery tracking logic.
feature_evidence.json: Empty feature evidence report JSON file with no features listed.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-to-two sentence summaries of each frontend source file, describing their purpose, key features, and notable implementation details.
frontend/DEPLOY_RETRY.md: Deployment retry log documenting multiple build/deploy attempts with descriptions of backend Motoko filter syntax fixes, recovery mode corrections, and workout generation bug repairs across versions.
frontend/index.html: Root HTML entry point for the Gym Tracker PWA, configuring viewport, PWA meta tags, Apple touch icons, iOS splash screens, and loading the React app via Vite.
frontend/public/manifest.json: PWA manifest for Gym Tracker specifying app name, icons (192x192 and 512x512), display mode, theme/background colors, and fitness-related categories.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing authentication state, page navigation between all app screens, workout generation with validation (duplicate/empty checks), and lazy-loaded page components with a splash screen.
Modal dialog component for logging and updating the user's bodyweight, with input validation, unit selection (kg/lb), and profile update via mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/BottomNav.tsx: Renders a fixed bottom navigation bar with five tabs (Home, Workout, Progress, History, Settings) and opens a SettingsModal when the Settings tab is tapped, with haptic vibration feedback on each tap.
frontend/src/components/ExerciseChangeMo: Dialog modal that fetches and displays alternative exercises for the same muscle group as the current exercise, records the user's selection via a backend mutation, and notifies the parent component of the change.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Sticky top header displaying the FitTrack logo/brand name with Settings and Logout icon buttons; logout clears the Internet Identity session and React Query cache.
frontend/src/components/ProfileLoadingSc: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/PullToRefresh.ts: Wraps children with touch-event-based pull-to-refresh functionality, showing an animated spinner indicator and triggering an async onRefresh callback when the pull threshold is reached.
Displays a card showing per-muscle-group recovery percentages with color-coded progress bars and status badges, optionally using a weighted average for leg subgroups.
frontend/src/components/SettingsModal.ts: Dialog modal for editing user profile settings (gender, bodyweight, weight unit, training frequency, dark mode, rest timers), persisting changes to the backend and syncing the theme via next-themes.
frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx: Full-screen animated splash screen shown on app load, displaying the Gym Tracker logo, name, and tagline with fade/zoom entrance animations.
frontend/src/components/StatusBar.tsx: Sticky top status bar that displays the user's current workout streak (with a flame icon) and today's formatted date.
frontend/src/components/WorkoutShareModa: A modal dialog component that generates a QR code and shareable link for a workout, supporting clipboard copy and native Web Share API.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using the current Internet Identity, invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendActor.ts: An empty file with no content.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks and mutations for interacting with the backend, including user profile, workouts, and exercises, with error handling utilities for auth, validation, and optimization errors.
frontend/src/hooks/useWakeLock.ts: A React hook that manages the Screen Wake Lock API to prevent screen dimming, with automatic re-acquisition on visibility change and comprehensive error handling.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file enforcing a dark-only Telegram-inspired theme with CSS custom properties, mobile optimizations, iOS safe area support, and page transition animations.
frontend/src/lib/profileCache.ts: An empty file with no content.
frontend/src/lib/sessionStorage.ts: Provides utilities to save, load, clear, and check active workout sessions in browser sessionStorage, with a 24-hour expiry on stored state.
frontend/src/lib/timestampUtils.ts: Utility functions to detect, convert, validate, and format backend BigInt timestamps (nanoseconds or milliseconds) into human-readable date strings.
Builds ordered workout sections from a flat exercise list, enforcing a fixed muscle-group order (Chest→Back→Shoulders→Arms→Legs→Core) with Legs split into subsections.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Dashboard page displaying workout history stats, recovery heatmap, streak, and navigation to new workout, history, and progress pages, with pull-to-refresh support.
frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx: History page showing a calendar of trained dates and a list of past workouts with formatted timestamps and volume, with pull-to-refresh support.
frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx: Login page presenting the FitTrack branding, feature highlights, and an Internet Identity login button with loading state handling.
frontend/src/pages/NewWorkoutPage.tsx: Page that lets users select a workout type (Full Body, Upper Body, Lower Body) and triggers AI workout generation via mutation hooks, then passes the result to the parent via callback.
frontend/src/pages/OnboardingPage.tsx: Initial setup form that collects user profile data (gender, bodyweight, weight unit, training frequency, rest times) and saves it via the saveCallerUserProfile mutation.
frontend/src/pages/ProgressPage.tsx: Displays muscle group recovery status and weekly training volume with color-coded progress indicators, supporting pull-to-refresh via React Query cache invalidation.
frontend/src/pages/SharedWorkoutPage.tsx: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/pages/WorkoutPreviewPage.ts: Shows a generated workout plan before starting, validates for duplicates and data integrity, and allows exercise swaps via a modal or full workout regeneration.
frontend/src/pages/WorkoutSessionPage.ts: Active workout session page managing per-exercise set logging, rest timers, wake lock, PR detection, confetti particles, session persistence, and weight suggestion updates.
frontend/src/types.ts: Defines frontend-only TypeScript interfaces for exercises, sets, workouts, muscle recovery state, volume metrics, and set configurations used throughout the app.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, persisting, and clearing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage fallback support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with dark mode, custom color tokens (using CSS variables), extended border radii, box shadows, font sizes, and animation keyframes for the frontend.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file (v17) documenting the current status of a Motoko workout generator backend, including known bugs (Text.toLower() filter failure, recovery mode offset), pending fix requests, and deployment pipeline issues.
